case_vignette: A 48-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 4-month history of persistent cough productive of white phlegm. He coughs consistently throughout the day, and he has not noticed any particular triggers that make it worse. He has also recently experienced some shortness of breath with exertion. He has not had any weight loss, fever, or chills. He had similar symptoms last year, which lasted about 6 months. He has hypertension, for which he takes amlodipine. He has worked in construction for the past 10 years. He has smoked a pack of cigarettes per day for 30 years. Vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows an end-expiratory wheeze throughout all lung zones.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been dealing with a persistent cough that produces white phlegm and shortness of breath when I exert myself.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for about 4 months.
Do you have any history of smoking or exposure to airborne irritants?
Yes, I have smoked a pack of cigarettes per day for 30 years and I have worked in construction for the past 10 years.
Have you noticed any weight loss during these 4 months?
No, I have not had any weight loss.
Do you have any history of heart disease or other chronic illnesses in your family?
I have hypertension, for which I take amlodipine, but there's no mention of any family history of heart disease or other chronic illnesses.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
